result.execSummary:
The defendant Wes J Van Epps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,150.  $125 to Eway Sales and Pawn, $825 to Mr. Money USA and $200 to Pawn America.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Write a letter of apology to Joel W Harris, give to agent first to review. 
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Use single pharmacy for prescription medication. 
Sign all health and medical releases for DOC to monitor compliance.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  DOC can accept treatment already completed if deemed appropriate.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final.

Defendant Wes J Van Epps in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:18 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

An amended information has been filed.
Count 1 is amended to three counts.

Defendant will plead to 3 counts.

State  addresses the plea agreement.
State files the restitution summary.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
There are no victims present.

Atty Renc concurs but addresses the AODA treatment.
Defendant concurs.

Atty Renc has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Theft
Count 2: Misdemeanor Theft
Count 3: Misdemeanor Theft

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
14 days pretrial incarceration credit.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed
14 Days Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $200 plus costs
Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,150
 -$125 Eways Sales and Pawn
 -$825 Mr Money USA
 -$200 Pawn America
Obtain AODA and comply with treament recommendations. DOC can accept treatment already completed if deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs
Do not possess any dangerous weapons
Write a letter of apology to Joel W Harris, give to agent first to review 
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Use single pharmacy for prescription medication
Sign all health and medical releases for DOC to monitor compliance

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 40 Days, consecutive to Count 1, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 
Pay costs

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 40 Days, consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs

Atty Renc notes she filed a motion to modify bond on Tuesday last week.  Makes arguments in support of her motion. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 

BY THE COURT: Court will modify the bond to $500 cash bond.

Defendant Wes J Van Epps in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Wes J Van Epps in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.

for Modification of Bond

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
